event: Earliest human presence in present-day Switzerland after Ice Age retreat
Celtic Helvetii inhabit the Swiss Plateau
Roman conquest defeats the Helvetii and incorporates the region
Roman cities and roads shape settlement patterns
Roman authority collapses during the Migration Period
Region becomes part of the Carolingian Empire
Forest cantons form an alliance, founding the Swiss Confederation
Swiss defeat Habsburg forces, securing independence
Swiss defeat at Marignano ends territorial expansion
Reformation spreads, dividing Switzerland along religious lines
Treaty of Westphalia recognizes Swiss independence from the Empire
French invasion creates the Helvetic Republic
Congress of Vienna guarantees Swiss neutrality
Federal constitution creates the modern Swiss state
Switzerland remains neutral during World War I
Armed neutrality maintained during World War II
Switzerland emerges as a center of diplomacy and finance
